item.title: Modeling Internet Traffic Generation for Telecommunication Applications
item.description:
With: Sara Stoudt, Pamela Badian-Pessot, Vera Bao, Erika Earley, Yadira Flores, Liza Maharjan, Blanche Ngo Mahop, Van Nguyen, Laura Rosenbauer, Danielle Williams, and Weijia Zhang. Part of the Industrial Careers in Mathematical Sciences Program (PIC Math).

Advisors: Dr. Nessy Tania (Smith College) & Dr. Veena Mendiratta (Bell Labs)

The goal of this project was to develop a stochastic model that could predict and simulate traffic load on an internet network. The model takes as input number of users and proportion of internet application being used at a given time - namely web surfing, video streaming, online gaming - and outputs simulated traffic data. Using individual user data, we produced models for web surfing, video streaming, and gaming which were combined to form the simulator. The first method fit known theoretical distributions to the data to simulate individual packets; the second used an empirical copula to simulate packets per second.

Read our paper here.
